item.description:
THE IRA’S SINGLES EVENTS

PRESENTS

A FUN FILLED EVENING OF CULTURE AND DINING (How Fun)

“THE LAST FIVE YEARS”

A PERSONAL AND INTIMATE MUSICAL

Saturday June 19

THE EXCITING DEATAILS ARE BELOW.

The Before and After Details:

Dinner and Drinks starting at 6:00 pm
At 6 we meet at Plan B Burger Bar (I was there last week, very cool place to “hang” and food was good)
http://www.planbburge...
138 Park Road
West Hartford CT.
7:45ish- To Theater
10:00pm ish- after party on Park Road.


Date: June 19. Saturday Evening. 8:00 P.M.

Where: Playhouse on Park (I love this name. “Playhouse”)
244 Park Road
West Hartford, CT 06119
860-523-5900
http://www.playhouseo... I have been to this theater many times, and I so much enjoy its warm and friendly atmosphere. It is very small and intimate theatre with seating on 3 sides of the stage. The farthest seat away is only 15 or 20 feet from the stage.

Performance: The Last Five Years (Write Up is below)

The Important Ticket Information

Price is just 22.50. Discounted to 20.00. A savings of 10%. 18 Tickets Only.
R.S.V.P. On or before, June 14. . Full Payment is required to hold your seat. (After this date, if tickets are available, cost will be 25.00.

Please email ASAP, Subject Line, June 19 PlayHouse, and I will send you my PayPal Account for Payment to hold your seat. Email: mistrchrming@aol.com. 860-604-5792
www.theirassinglesevents.com




In this personal and intimate musical, Jason Robert Brown (Parade, Songs for a New World, Thirteen) takes the conventions of Broadway and sends them spinning into the 21st century. Brown uses his wit and insight to tell a contemporary story of a relationship between a writer and an actress falling in and out of love and told from both points of view. Contains some strong language and situations; intended for mature audiences.
Directed by Kyle Fabel
item.how_to_find_us: In Lobby at 7:45, or at Dinner.

group.name: The West Hartford Over 40 Fun Bunch!
